block.p: Amy Mary Frohling, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lucien O. Frohling of North Caldwell, N.J., was married there yesterday to Benjamin Charles Curcio, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard P. Curcio of Chatham, Mass. Msgr. Edward J. Ciuba performed the ceremony at Notre Dame Church.

Mrs. Curcio, 28, is an assistant vice president for consumer sales at First Union National Bank in Summit, N.J. She graduated from Bucknell University. Her father, a marketing consultant, retired as a vice president for marketing at Citibank in New York.

Amy Mary Frohling, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lucien O. Frohling of North Caldwell, N.J., was married there yesterday to Benjamin Charles Curcio, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard P. Curcio of Chatham, Mass. Msgr. Edward J. Ciuba performed the ceremony at Notre Dame Church.

Mrs. Curcio, 28, is an assistant vice president for consumer sales at First Union National Bank in Summit, N.J. She graduated from Bucknell University. Her father, a marketing consultant, retired as a vice president for marketing at Citibank in New York.

Mr. Curcio, 27, is an associate at the law offices of Noel E. Schablik in Parsippany, N.J. He graduated cum laude from the University of Massachusetts at Amherst and received a law degree from Seton Hall University.
The bridegroom's father is the principal of the Cape Cod Regional Technical High School in Harwich, Mass.
